title: Consolidate redundant guidance across skills
description: Extract common patterns (cost optimization, token efficiency, shell commands, schema design) into shared documentation to reduce token usage by 20-30% when multiple skills are loaded

title: Identify duplicated content across SKILL.md files
description: Compare all SKILL.md files to find repeated sections: cost optimization strategies, token efficiency guidance, shell command patterns, schema design principles. Document specific duplications with file paths and line numbers.

title: Categorize content (local vs shared)
description: For identified duplications, decide what should stay in individual SKILL.md files (skill-specific context) vs what should move to shared documentation (universal patterns). Consider skill-loading scenarios and context efficiency.

title: Design shared documentation structure and reference pattern
description: Propose where shared docs should live (docs/llm-best-practices.md?), how individual skills reference them, and how Claude Code loads them. Ensure references work when skills are loaded individually. Create implementation tickets.

title: Add structured error recovery patterns
description: Add ERROR_HANDLING sections with condition→action mappings to enable autonomous error recovery when LLMs encounter Exa API errors

title: Research Exa API error response formats and codes
description: Review Exa API documentation, exa-ai gem source code, or make test API calls to catalog error types, response formats, status codes, and error messages. Document common failure scenarios.

title: Collect common error scenarios from documentation
description: Scan existing SKILL.md and REFERENCE.md files for mentions of errors, failures, edge cases, or troubleshooting guidance. Extract patterns that should have structured error recovery.

title: Design ERROR_PATTERNS structure
description: Define format for condition→action error recovery mappings. Consider how LLMs will parse and apply these patterns. Design integration with existing documentation. Create implementation tickets.

title: Standardize critical requirement formatting for LLM parsing
description: Create machine-parseable CRITICAL_RULES sections with MUST/MUST_NOT format to reduce instruction-following errors when LLMs consume skill documentation

title: Audit all SKILL.md files and catalog critical requirements
description: Scan all SKILL.md files in exa-core/, exa-research/, and exa-websets/ to identify sections containing critical requirements, rules, or constraints. Document file locations and current formatting patterns.

title: Document current formatting inconsistencies
description: Analyze how critical requirements are currently expressed (prose, bullets, bold text, sections, etc.). Provide examples of inconsistencies that could confuse LLM parsing.

title: Design standardized CRITICAL_RULES format
description: Propose a consistent, machine-parseable format for critical rules. Consider placement (top of file, dedicated section, inline), syntax (MUST/MUST_NOT prefixes), and how skills reference shared rules. Create implementation tickets based on design.
